famous quote:
Each of us is more than the worst thing we've ever done.
-Bryan Stevenson (in "Just Mercy")
Interview Text:
Martin:

(part 1)

I asked my friend Martin, "How do you hear from God? And has it led to anything interesting?"
 
This is his response:

Well, you ask an interesting question. I'll answer it to the best of my ability. Read below, 1 Kings 19: 11-13
 
11So He said, "Go forth and stand on the mountain before the LORD." And behold, the LORD was passing by! And a great and strong wind was rending the mountains and breaking in pieces the rocks before the LORD; but the LORD was not in the wind. And after the wind an earthquake, but the LORD was not in the earthquake. 12After the earthquake a fire, but the LORD was not in the fire; and after the fire a sound of a gentle blowing. 13When Elijah heard it, he wrapped his face in his mantle and went out and stood in the entrance of the cave. And behold, a voice came to him and said, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"...
 
The Lord speaks to me a lot.  Sometimes it is almost audible, but usually it is like a tugging, or a constant reminding. Do you remember the girl I tried to set you up with, Laurel, the missionary in China? Well, she is a very special girl to me, very much like a daughter. I've known her for 10 or 11 years. There are times when I wake up in the morning thinking about her. At first it was a little unnerving. Me, a married man, thinking about a beautiful, young, single girl; the first thing in the morning.
It actually concerned me for a while.

It did several things, it made me go to the Lord and talk to him about what was going on in my mind. I also started seeing a pattern.
When Laurel was really struggling with a situation:
e.g:      Her brother's emotional condition after a break up
            Her emotions after a break up
            Her struggles with back pain
            Her struggles with career choices

All these events would coincide with her automatically coming to my mind, when I was CALM.
Like a gentle breeze.

It only happens when I slowed down. I have had it happen with other people but not over and over again with the same person, except Laurel. 

I've had it happen with cousins going through marriage trouble. I had a friend and his wife on my heart for several days, so I called and asked, "How is Jen?" He couldn't believe what I was asking, because my thoughts of them, had begun at the same time they found out she was pregnant. He has had more children since, and I didn't get a message.

Was I not calm enough, or did the Lord not want me to be praying for them that time? I don't know. God is the boss.

Once, I actually started praying for Laurel's dog. As it turned out, her dog had torn up, and eaten part of her Bible. She thought her dog was demon possessed.
Music Video Instructions: Imagine if God's love for us, and ours for him was like this.
